title.exceptDesc: You can check the exception string of the monitored app.

msg.name: Batch name is a required input value.
msg.historydelete: Are you sure you want to delete your history?
msg.deleteWarning:
Normal MAXY system operation cannot be guaranteed in the event of deletion. 
MAXY is not responsible for any problems arising from deleting the batch. 
If you wish to delete, please enter `I agree to deletion.`
msg.execute: The batch will be executed soon.

package.name: App ID
package.feeldexInfo: You can adjust the criteria for the 5-level customer experience scoring.
package.dataCollectionRate: You can adjust the data collection rate for monitoring. (Default: 100%)
package.sessionReplayRateDesc: You can adjust the Session Replay rate. Lower rates reduce server load.
package.sessionReplayRateWarning: ※ Setting the rate to 70% or higher may cause significant load on the collection server.
package.sessionReplayBlockDesc1: This feature blocks areas that should not be monitored in Session Replay.
package.sessionReplayBlockDesc2: You can register elements to be excluded from monitoring by app, and completely exclude the DOM and content of those areas from session recordings.
package.sessionReplayBlockDesc3: You can apply blocking rules by adding the ID or class of UI elements that contain sensitive information.

msg.packageName: App ID must be up to 100 characters and may only include letters, numbers, '.', '-', and '_'.
msg.valid.numberrange: Only numbers between $1 and $2 are allowed.
msg.valid.number: Only numbers greater than or equal to 0 are allowed.
msg.deleteWarning:
Deleting this may cause the MAXY system to malfunction.
MAXY is not responsible for any issues caused by deleting a app.
To confirm deletion, please type 'I agree to delete'.
msg.valid.appinfo: App information and server type are required fields.

desc.useYn: Select whether the app is enabled or disabled
desc.monitoringYn: Select whether monitoring is enabled or disabled
desc.integrationYn: Select whether to display on the integrated dashboard
desc.zipYn: Select whether to compress log data before transmission
desc.fullMsgYn: Select whether to collect API request messages
desc.fullReqMsgYn: Select whether to collect API response messages
desc.infoYn: Select whether to store parameters passed when calling the maxy.login() function from native source code and attach them to every MAXY data transmission
desc.appType: Select whether to switch to the MAXY Front monitoring service
desc.sReplayYn: Select whether to collect session replay data

msg.delete: Are you sure you want to delete the code?
msg.groupcodename: Code group name is a required.

msg.onlynumber: Only numbers can be entered in Interval.
msg.onlyoneover: Interval can only be entered as a number greater than 1.
msg.onlytimenumber: Only numbers can be entered for the start time (hour).
msg.onlytimemax: The start time (hour) can only be entered as numbers from 0 to 23.
msg.onlyminutenumber: Only numbers can be entered in the start time (minutes).
msg.onlyminutemax: The start time (minutes) can only be entered as numbers from 0 to 59.
msg.onlyendtimenumber: Only numbers can be entered for the end time (hours).
msg.onlyendtimemax: The end time (hours) can only be entered as numbers from 0 to 23.
msg.onlyendtimestarttime: The end time (in hours) must be greater than the start time (in hours).
msg.onlyendminutenumber: Only numbers can be entered in the end time (minutes).
msg.onlyendminutemax: The end time (minutes) can only be entered as numbers from 0 to 59.

msg.delete: Are you sure you want to delete it? Deleted items will no longer be processed as exceptions.
msg.exceptCount: Up to 20 exceptions can be handled.
msg.exceptModify: Remove unnecessary syntax for smooth exception handling.
msg.exceptConfirm:
Exception items are managed separately in the system management menu. 
 For smooth exception handling, unnecessary statements can be removed before reflection.
